rComments: I loved Professor Tucey. Her lectures were very clear and easy to follow. She is a very nice woman and she is extremely helpful. I wish she taught more classes at UCSC because I learned a lot from her.

I would NEVER recommend taking a class taught by Cynthia Tucey. Poli 20 is the most BS class I've taken in college; I feel like a middle school student being limited by bureaucratic methods of material/assignment simplification for the ease of grading. This class and grading system will make you feel like an imbecile.

POLI/LGST 120B analyzes Q's like, "What is public opinion?" And, "What are opinion polls?" Cynthia Tucey's class was at the level of a high school class. Her lectures read right from the slides, and most of the reading material was painful to get through. I recommend avoiding classes taught by her.

Tucey's class was extremely easy to the point of being pointless. The readings were interesting but the lectures were not engaging and did not compel me to read them. Easy class, but thats not what we are paying for

Professor Tucey is one of the nicest and most helpful professors I've ever had. She gives very clear and interesting lectures and the work load is limited to a midterm, which was easy, a 5 minute presentation, a paper, and a final. Attendence is necessary though, she takes attendence in my class. Overall, I really enjoyed her class.
